identificationModule.briefTitle: Early Neurological Trajectory and Clinical Outcomes in Brain Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Early Neurological Trajectory and Clinical Outcomes in Brain Acute Ischemic Stroke

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Deputy Director of Department of Radiology

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Prospective identification of potential responsible blood vessels, provision of intervention targets, prevention of fatal and disabling cerebrovascular diseases, identification of early END patients, determination of clinical treatment pathways, improvement of efficacy, and improvement of prognosis

primaryOutcomes.description: The blood vessels that cause stroke
The volume of high signal in the infarcted area on DWl or T2 FLAIR

The NIHSS score includes: consciousness level (consciousness level, consciousness level questioning, consciousness level instruction), gaze, field of vision, facial paralysis, upper limb movement, lower limb movement, limb ataxia, sensation, language, articulation disorders, and neglect. The scoring range is 0-42 points, with higher scores indicating more severe neurological damage

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: A. Acute Perforating artery stroke patients within 48 hours of onset; B. Age ≥ 18 years and ≤ 80 years old; C. Have two or more vascular risk factors, including hypertension, diabetes, coronary heart disease, hyperlipidemia, smoking and obesity; D. Sign an informed consent form;
